poem:
"Airport Echoes at Dawn"

In the breath-handed scramble of shadows,
A chorus of gates hum back to life –
A digital symphony for weary travelers.
Delayed among the footfalls of Heathrow,
Gatwick, shepherds of Stansted's ghostly apparition,
And far-flung, echo-hung serenades of Bristol.
Reminding us, as dawn struggles through glass,
Of borders drawn by hand and pixel,
In the fleeting kingdom of arrivals and departures.
